projects.title: Facebook Clone
projects.description: This project was an assignment from Microverse training. It's a Facebook clone. Users can create an account or sign up with their original Facebook account. Logged in, they can post, like, and comment on posts. Also, they can request friendship from other users and create chat rooms to talk with other users.

projects.title: Capsule Wardrobe
projects.description: The Capsule Wardrobe app allows users to create an account and upload images of their clothes,  creating a catalog of their wardrobe. The items can be categorized in personalized lists and the user can create looks with the uploaded items

projects.title: Space Burna
projects.description: This was my Capstone project for Microverse's JavaScript course. Space Burna is a classic shooting game that happens in the space. The goal is to survive for the longest possible time, while you destroy the enemies and avoid being shot to death.

projects.title: Tic-Tac-Toe
projects.description: In this project, a coding partner and I developed a classic Tic-Tac-Toe game, with a creative and modern design. It consists of a single page application and was built using the JavaScript module pattern.  Players can add their names and keep track of the score.

projects.title: The Weather App
projects.description: The Weather App uses the OpenWeather API to allow users to search for weather information in cities worldwide. It has a modern design, and the background reflects the current temperature, using CSS animations.

projects.title: OhMyMood!
projects.description: OhMyMood! is a mobile web-application to track moods and emotions. To develop this app, I used React on the front-end, using Redux to manage the internal state. The back-end was built with Ruby on Rails.

projects.title: Worthy Work
projects.description: This project consists of a job search platform, focused on the humanitarian field. It was built with React and Redux and uses the  ReliefWeb API to get the information.
